questions.question_text: Which semi-structured data formats can be loaded into Snowflake with a COPY command? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D and E.

questions.question_text: What is the recommended Snowflake data type to store semi-structured data like JSON?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D. VARIANT

The VARIANT data type is specifically designed to efficiently store and query semi-structured data such as JSON, Avro, Parquet, and XML. It allows Snowflake to handle complex data structures and perform schema-on-read operations, making it ideal for storing and processing semi-structured data.
Object, Variant and Array are the semi structured data types supports in snowflake.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

questions.question_text: Which statements reflect valid commands when using secondary roles? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
The currently active primary role sets the context that determines whether the current user has the necessary privileges to execute CREATE <object> statements or perform any other SQL action.

Authorization to perform any SQL action other than creating objects can be provided by secondary roles.

I think it should be C and E.
"USE SECONDARY ROLES { ALL | NONE }"
Reference from => https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/use-secondary-roles.html

Selected Answer: C
page - 14 days
account_usage.query_history - 365 days

questions.question_text: How long is a query visible in the Query History page in the Snowflake Web Interface (UI)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It's not waiting in queue, so additional warehouse is not required. It's facing performance issues , hence resizing the current warehouse " scaling up" should be right answer IMO. So , A is the answer.

Selected Answer: C
Its best option refer the documentation

Selected Answer: A
If queries processed by a warehouse are running slowly, you can always resize the warehouse to provision more compute resources.

Selected Answer: C
When you notice that a query is running slowly, check whether an overloaded warehouse is causing the query to compete for resources or get queued:

If the running query load is high or thereâ€™s queuing, consider starting a separate warehouse and moving queued queries to that warehouse. Alternatively, if you are using multi-cluster warehouses, you could change your multi-cluster settings to add additional clusters to handle higher concurrency going forward.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/warehouses-load-monitoring.html#slow-query-performance

Selected Answer: C
C from the video here : https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/warehouses-overview.html#

choices.B: Create separate warehouses for each user
choices.D: Stop loading and querying data at the same time
choices.C: Create separate warehouses for each workload

questions.question_text:
Two users share a virtual warehouse named WH_DEV_01. When one of the users loads data, the other one experiences performance issues while querying data.

How does Snowflake recommend resolving this issue?
